subject: Music
title: Musical Chills
description: A short lesson to help you apply Musical Chills.

hook.text: About two-thirds of people get goosebumps from music ‚Äî scientists call them frisson.

buildup.text: Frisson happens when a song violates your expectations in a pleasurable way.

discovery.text: A sudden key change, a voice cracking, or a crescendo can trigger the response.

twist.text: People who get chills have denser neural connections between auditory and emotional regions.

climax.text: The same autonomic system that responds to cold or fear responds to beautiful music.

punchline.text: Your body can't tell the difference between danger and beauty.

quiz.question: What causes musical frisson or chills?
options: A song pleasurably violating your expectations
